p: The essential oils of resin contain a high percentage of compounds with known antibacterial and antifungal properties. Nowadays, bacterial infections remain a major cause of morbidity and mortality in humans and animals. The phenomenon of antibiotic-resistant bacteria continues to increase in frequency and number worldwide, and new resistance problems have recently emerged, which further complicates and hinders the treatment of critical infectious diseases [ 49]. Besides, the use of natural products such as essential oils as antimicrobial compounds has many advantages. These comprise fewer adverse effects, better patient tolerance, relative inexpensiveness, and wide acceptance because of their traditional applications, renewable nature, and better biodegradability [ 50].
